intro: Globimetula mayombensis, commonly known as the Mayombé globemallow, is a flowering plant native to Central Africa. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its globular, woolly leaves and showy, pale yellow to orange flowers. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its unique morphology and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
